Package infodynamics.measures.continuous

Class TransferEntropyCalculatorMultiVariateViaCondMutualInfo

  • java.lang.Object
    • infodynamics.measures.continuous.TransferEntropyCalculatorViaCondMutualInfo
      • infodynamics.measures.continuous.TransferEntropyCalculatorMultiVariateViaCondMutualInfo
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ChannelCalculator, ChannelCalculatorCommon, ChannelCalculatorMultiVariate, InfoMeasureCalculatorContinuous, TransferEntropyCalculator, TransferEntropyCalculatorMultiVariate, EmpiricalNullDistributionComputer
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    TransferEntropyCalculatorMultiVariateGaussian, TransferEntropyCalculatorMultiVariateKraskov
    public class TransferEntropyCalculatorMultiVariateViaCondMutualInfo
extends TransferEntropyCalculatorViaCondMutualInfo
implements TransferEntropyCalculatorMultiVariate
    A Multivariate Transfer Entropy (TE) calculator (implementing TransferEntropyCalculatorMultiVariate) which is affected using a given Conditional Mutual Information (MI) calculator (implementing ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariate) to make the calculations.

    Usage is as per the paradigm outlined for TransferEntropyCalculatorMultiVariate, except that in the constructor(s) for this class the implementation for a ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariate must be supplied.

    This class may be used directly, however users are advised that several child classes are available which already plug-in the various conditional MI estimators to provide TE calculators (taking specific caution associated with each type of estimator):

    • TransferEntropyCalculatorMultiVariateGaussian
    • TransferEntropyCalculatorMultiVariateKraskov

    This implementation inherits from the TransferEntropyCalculatorViaCondMutualInfo, so the univariate methods for adding observations etc are still available, however they will throw Exceptions if this calculator was not initialised for single dimensional data sets.

    References:

    • T. Schreiber, "Measuring information transfer", Physical Review Letters 85 (2) pp.461-464, 2000.
    • J. T. Lizier, M. Prokopenko and A. Zomaya, "Local information transfer as a spatiotemporal filter for complex systems" Physical Review E 77, 026110, 2008.
    • J.T. Lizier, J. Heinzle, A. Horstmann, J.-D. Haynes, M. Prokopenko, "Multivariate information-theoretic measures reveal directed information structure and task relevant changes in fMRI connectivity", Journal of Computational Neuroscience, vol. 30, pp. 85-107, 2011.
    Author:
    Joseph Lizier, email, www
    See Also:
    TransferEntropyCalculatorViaCondMutualInfo, TransferEntropyCalculatorMultiVariate, TransferEntropyCalculator

      • setObservations

        public void setObservations​(double[][] source,
                            double[][] destination)
                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: ChannelCalculatorMultiVariate
        Sets a single series from which to compute the PDF for the channel measure. Cannot be called in conjunction with other methods for setting/adding observations.

        The supplied series are certainly (multivariate) time-series for time-series measures such as transfer entropy, however may be simply a set of separate observations for the mutual information without a time interpretation.

        Specified by:
        setObservations in interface ChannelCalculatorMultiVariate
        Parameters:
        source - series of multivariate observations for the source variable (first index is time or observation index, second is variable number)
        destination - series of multivariate observations for the destination variable (first index is time or observation index, second is variable number). Length must match source, and their indices must correspond.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • addObservations

        public void addObservations​(double[] source,
                            double[] destination)
                     throws java.lang.Exception

        Adds a new set of univariate observations to compute the PDFs from. Can only be called on this multivariate calculator if the dimensions of both source and destination are 1, otherwise throws an exception

        Adds a new set of observations to update the PDFs with. It is intended to be called multiple times, and must be called after ChannelCalculatorCommon.startAddObservations(). Call ChannelCalculatorCommon.finaliseAddObservations() once all observations have been supplied.

        Important: this does not append these observations to the previously supplied observations, but treats them independently - i.e. measurements such as the transfer entropy will not join them up to examine k consecutive values in time.

        Note that the arrays source and destination must not be over-written by the user until after ChannelCalculatorCommon.finaliseAddObservations() has been called (they are not copied by this method necessarily, but the method may simply hold a pointer to them).

        Specified by:
        addObservations in interface ChannelCalculator
        Specified by:
        addObservations in interface ChannelCalculatorMultiVariate
        Overrides:
        addObservations in class TransferEntropyCalculatorViaCondMutualInfo
        Parameters:
        source - univariate observations for the source variable
        destination - univariate observations for the destination variable
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if initialised dimensions were not 1

      • addObservationsWithGivenParams

        protected static int addObservationsWithGivenParams​(ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariate condMiCalc_in_use,
                                                    int k_in_use,
                                                    int k_tau_in_use,
                                                    int l_in_use,
                                                    int l_tau_in_use,
                                                    int delay_in_use,
                                                    double[][] source,
                                                    double[][] destination)
                                             throws java.lang.Exception
        As per {superTransferEntropyCalculatorViaCondMutualInfo.addObservationsWithGivenParams(ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariate, int, int, int, int, int, double[], double[]) but with multivariate time series.
        Parameters:
        condMiCalc_in_use - conditional MI calculator to use
        k_in_use - k embedding dimension to use for target
        k_tau_in_use - target tau embedding delay to use
        l_in_use - l embedding dimension to use for source
        l_tau_in_use - source tau embedding delay to use
        delay_in_use - source-target delay to use
        source - multivariate time series of source observations
        destination - multivariate time series of destination observations
        Returns:
        the number of observations added
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

        l_in_use - l embedding dimension to use for source
        l_tau_in_use - source tau embedding delay to use
        delay_in_use - source-target delay to use
        source - time series of source observations
        destination - time series of destination observations
        source - multivariate time series of source observations
        destination - multivariate time series of destination observations
        sourceValid - array (with indices the same as source) indicating whether the source at that index is valid.
        destValid - array (with indices the same as destination) indicating whether the destination at that index is valid.
        Returns:
        total number of observations added
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • addObservations

        public void addObservations​(double[] source,
                            double[] destination,
                            int startTime,
                            int numTimeSteps)
                     throws java.lang.Exception

        Adds a new sub-series of univariate observations to compute the PDFs from. Can only be called on this multivariate calculator if the dimensions of both source and destination are 1, otherwise throws an exception

        Adds a new set of observations to update the PDFs with, as a subset of the supplied arrays. It is intended to be called multiple times, and must be called after ChannelCalculatorCommon.startAddObservations(). Call ChannelCalculatorCommon.finaliseAddObservations() once all observations have been supplied.

        Important: this does not append these observations to the previously supplied observations, but treats them independently - i.e. measurements such as the transfer entropy will not join them up to examine k consecutive values in time.

        Note that the arrays source and destination must not be over-written by the user until after finaliseAddObservations() has been called (they are not copied by this method necessarily, but the method may simply hold a pointer to them).

        Specified by:
        addObservations in interface ChannelCalculator
        Overrides:
        addObservations in class TransferEntropyCalculatorViaCondMutualInfo
        Parameters:
        source - univariate observations for the source variable
        destination - univariate observations for the destination variable
        startTime - first index to take observations on
        numTimeSteps - number of steps from and including startTime to use
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if initialised dimensions were not 1

      • addObservations

        public void addObservations​(double[][] source,
                            double[][] destination,
                            int startTime,
                            int numTimeSteps)
                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: ChannelCalculatorMultiVariate

        Adds a new sub-series of observations to update the PDFs with - is intended to be called multiple times. Must be called after ChannelCalculatorCommon.startAddObservations(); call ChannelCalculatorCommon.finaliseAddObservations() once all observations have been supplied.

        Important: this does not append these observations to the previously supplied observations, but treats them independently - i.e. measurements such as the transfer entropy will not join them up to examine k consecutive values in time.

        Note that the arrays source and destination must not be over-written by the user until after finaliseAddObservations() has been called (they are not copied by this method necessarily, but the method may simply hold a pointer to them).

        Specified by:
        addObservations in interface ChannelCalculatorMultiVariate
        Parameters:
        source - series of multivariate observations for the source variable (first index is time or observation index, second is variable number)
        destination - series of multivariate observations for the destination variable (first index is time or observation index, second is variable number). Length must match source, and their indices must correspond.
        startTime - first index to take observations on
        numTimeSteps - number of steps from and including startTime to use
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • setObservations

        public void setObservations​(double[] source,
                            double[] destination,
                            boolean[] sourceValid,
                            boolean[] destValid)
                     throws java.lang.Exception

        Adds a new sub-series of univariate observations to compute the PDFs from. Can only be called on this multivariate calculator if the dimensions of both source and destination are 1, otherwise throws an exception

        Sets the single set of observations to compute the PDFs from, but only where these observations are indicated to be valid. Cannot be called in conjunction with other methods for setting/adding observations.

        The supplied series are certainly time-series for time-series measures such as transfer entropy, however may be simply a set of separate observations for the mutual information without a time interpretation.

        Specified by:
        setObservations in interface ChannelCalculator
        Overrides:
        setObservations in class TransferEntropyCalculatorViaCondMutualInfo
        Parameters:
        source - univariate observations for the source variable
        destination - univariate observations for the destination variable
        sourceValid - array (with indices the same as source) indicating whether the source at that index is valid.
        destValid - array (with indices the same as destination) indicating whether the destination at that index is valid.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if initialised dimensions were not 1

      • setObservations

        public void setObservations​(double[][] source,
                            double[][] destination,
                            boolean[] sourceValid,
                            boolean[] destValid)
                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: ChannelCalculatorMultiVariate

        Sets the single set of observations to compute the PDFs from, where the source and destination observations are valid. Cannot be called in conjunction with other methods for setting/adding observations.

        The supplied series are certainly time-series for time-series measures such as transfer entropy, however may be simply a set of separate observations for the mutual information without a time interpretation.

        Specified by:
        setObservations in interface ChannelCalculatorMultiVariate
        Parameters:
        source - series of multivariate observations for the source variable (first index is time or observation index, second is variable number)
        destination - series of multivariate observations for the destination variable (first index is time or observation index, second is variable number). Length must match source, and their indices must correspond.
        sourceValid - series (with first indices the same as source) indicating whether the source at that index is valid.
        destValid - time series (with first indices the same as destination) indicating whether the destination at that index is valid.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • setObservations

        public void setObservations​(double[][] source,
                            double[][] destination,
                            boolean[][] sourceValid,
                            boolean[][] destValid)
                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: ChannelCalculatorMultiVariate

        Sets the single set of observations to compute the PDFs from, where the source and destination observations are valid for all joint variables. Cannot be called in conjunction with other methods for setting/adding observations.

        Specified by:
        setObservations in interface ChannelCalculatorMultiVariate
        Parameters:
        source - series of multivariate observations for the source variable (first index is time or observation index, second is variable number)
        destination - series of multivariate observations for the destination variable (first index is time or observation index, second is variable number). Length must match source, and their indices must correspond.
        sourceValid - series (with indices the same as source) indicating whether each variable of the source at that index is valid.
        destValid - time series (with indices the same as destination) indicating whether each variable of the destination at that index is valid.

      • preFinaliseAddObservations

        protected void preFinaliseAddObservations()
                                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from class: TransferEntropyCalculatorViaCondMutualInfo
        Hook in case this or child implementations need to perform any processing on the observation time series prior to their being processed and supplied to the underlying MI calculator. Primarily this is to allow this or child implementation to automatically determine embedding parameters if desired. Child implementations do not need to override this default empty implementation if no new functionality is required.
        Overrides:
        preFinaliseAddObservations in class TransferEntropyCalculatorViaCondMutualInfo
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

        Prepare the given pre-instantiated (and properties supplied) Conditional mutual information calculator with this data set, using the embedding parameters supplied. This may be used in the final calculation, or by the auto-embedding procedures, hence the use of method arguments rather than using the member variables directly.

        prepareCMICalculator in class TransferEntropyCalculatorViaCondMutualInfo

        condMiCalc_in_use - conditional MI calculator to use

      • computeLocalUsingPreviousObservations

        public double[] computeLocalUsingPreviousObservations​(double[] newSourceObservations,
                                                      double[] newDestObservations)
                                               throws java.lang.Exception

        Computes the local values of the transfer entropy for each valid observation in the supplied univariate observations Can only be called on this multivariate calculator if the dimensions of both source and destination are 1, otherwise throws an exception

        Compute the local measure values for each of the supplied samples in newSourceObservations and newDestObservations.

        PDFs are computed using all of the previously supplied observations, but not those in newSourceObservations and newDestObservations (unless they were some of the previously supplied samples).

        Specified by:
        computeLocalUsingPreviousObservations in interface ChannelCalculator
        Overrides:
        computeLocalUsingPreviousObservations in class TransferEntropyCalculatorViaCondMutualInfo
        Parameters:
        newSourceObservations - univariate observations for the source variable
        newDestObservations - univariate observations for the destination variable
        Returns:
        the series of local channel measure values.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if initialised dimensions were not 1

                                                      double[][] newDestObservations)
                                               throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: ChannelCalculatorMultiVariate
        Compute the local measure values for each of the supplied samples in newSourceObservations and newDestObservations.

        PDFs are computed using all of the previously supplied observations, but not those in newSourceObservations and newDestObservations (unless they were some of the previously supplied samples).
